com.dhemery.osx
Class ApplicationBundle

java.lang.Object
  com.dhemery.osx.ApplicationBundle

public class ApplicationBundle
extends Object

Retrieves information from an application bundle. This "inspector" reads information from the bundle's Info.plist file, and also examines the permissions of the bundle's executable file.

Constructor Summary
ApplicationBundle(String path, Shell shell)
          Create an "inspector" that retrieves information from a specified application bundle.
 
Method Summary
 String bundleIdentifier()
          The bundle's version.
 String bundleVersion()
          The bundle's version.
 String executableName()
          The name of the bundle's executable file.
 boolean isExecutable()
          Report whether the bundle's executable file is executable.
 JsonInspector json()
          A JsonInspector with the contents of the bundle's Info.plist file.
 String pathToExecutable()
          The absolute path to the bundle's executable file.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

ApplicationBundle

public ApplicationBundle(String path,
                         Shell shell)
Create an "inspector" that retrieves information from a specified application bundle.

Parameters:
path - the absolute file path to the application bundle.
Method Detail

bundleIdentifier

public String bundleIdentifier()
The bundle's version.

bundleVersion

public String bundleVersion()
The bundle's version.

executableName

public String executableName()
The name of the bundle's executable file. This method does not verify that the file exists or that its "executable" bit is set.

isExecutable

public boolean isExecutable()
Report whether the bundle's executable file is executable. The file is executable if it exists and its "executable" bit is set.

pathToExecutable

public String pathToExecutable()
The absolute path to the bundle's executable file.

json

public JsonInspector json()
A JsonInspector with the contents of the bundle's Info.plist file.
